The Saguntinos at once sent an embassy to Rome to beg for assistance. The Romans, imagining that mere threats were enough now, as they had been when Sardinia was surrendered, sent envoys to warn Hannibal to desist. The latter was already far on with the siege. He declined to see the envoys, and they crossed over to Carthage. Here too they were repulsed3 and returned without success to Rome.
